setting.name: project_path
setting.comment: Project path for locating app resources

setting.name: if false, won't connect udp sender / listener for server or client
server:ip
setting.comment: the multicast ip address and port of the server

setting.name: platform:architecture
setting.comment: if this is a server (world engine), a client (render engine) or both (world + render). default ="", which is an EngineClientServer, aka "both"

setting.name: console:show
setting.comment: Show console will create a console window, or not if this is false. If this setting is missing, debug mode will create a console, release will not.

setting.name: how big the world size is, in pixels
screen:title
setting.comment:
If these settings are blank, the app will default to fullscreen on the main display <size name="world_dimensions" x="1920" y="1080" /> <rect name="src_rect" l="0" t="0" w="1920" h="1080" /> <rect name="src_rect" l="0" t="0" w="1920" h="1080" />
title of the window

setting.name: screen:mode
setting.comment: screen mode. full=fullscreen, borderless=no OS chrome, window=normal. default=window

setting.name: screen:always_on_top
setting.comment: makes the window an always-on-top sort of window. default=false

setting.name: attempt to run the app at this rate
hide_mouse
setting.comment: false=no cursor visible, true=visible cursor. default=false

setting.name: camera:z_clip
setting.comment: for perspective cameras, how near and far away to clip crap. default: x=1, y=1000

setting.name: camera:fov
setting.comment: the field of view of the perspective camera?

setting.name: camera:arrow_keys
setting.comment: how much to step the camera when using the arrow keys. set to a value above 0.025 to enable arrow key usage. default=-1.0

setting.name: Override the built-in touch scale and offset parsing. It's uncommon you'll need to do this. Default is to use the built-in Cinder touch translation (default=false)
touch_color
setting.comment: <rect name="touch_overlay:filter_rect" l="10" t="10" r="1910" b="1070" /> sets the color of debug touch points. default=255,255,255

setting.name: touch_overlay:debug
setting.comment: draw circles around touch points

setting.name: touch_overlay:verbose_logging
setting.comment: Prints out info for every touch info. Also can be set at runtime using shift-V

setting.name: touch_overlay:debug_circle_radius
setting.comment: visual settings for touch debug circles

setting.name: touch_smoothing
setting.comment: average out touch points over time for smoother input, but slightly less accurate. default=true

setting.name: touch_smooth_frames
setting.comment: how many frames to use when smoothing. Higher numbers are smoother. Lower than 3 is effectively off. default=5

setting.name: touch:minimum_distance
setting.comment: how many pixels away from an existing touch point for a new touch to be considered valid

setting.name: touch_overlay:trails:use
setting.comment: Touch trails are special debug drawing that leaves a trail behind the touches. use: true turns this on (overrides the stroked cirlce debug drawing (touch_overlay:debug must be true for this to be on) length: how many touch points to keep in the tail increment: how much bigger to make each touch point. Effective max size = (length-1) * increment. Defaults: use=false, length=5, increment=5. Effective size of 20 pixel radius circle.

setting.name: touch_mode
setting.comment: Set the current touch mode. Options: "Tuio" -- Receive events over TUIO. "TuioAndMouse" -- Receive both TUIO and mouse events. The default. "System" -- Receive native (Windows) system touch events. "SystemAndMouse" -- Receive both native touch events and mouse events. Will cause the first touch event to be discarded, because it is also a mouse event.

setting.name: tuio_port
setting.comment: port to listen to tuio stream. default=3333

setting.name: tuio:receive_objects
setting.comment: will allow tuio to receive object data. default=false

setting.name: tap_threshold
setting.comment: How far a touch moves before it's not a tap, in pixels

setting.name: idle_time
setting.comment: Seconds before idle happens. 300 = 5 minutes

setting.name: resource location and database for cms content <text name="resource_location" value="%USERPROFILE%\Documents\downstream\cms\example\" /> <text name="resource_db" value="db\production.sqlite3" />
